explanation: The original if-condition only checked vertical adjacency (same column) and ignored horizontal adjacency (same row). I fixed the single conditional line to also check whether the two cells in the top row are both '#' or the two cells in the bottom row are both '#'. This adds the missing horizontal-adjacency checks (logical OR) so any adjacent black pair — vertical or horizontal — yields "Yes". The change is analogous to the logical-operator fixes shown in the retrieved diffs that replace/augment AND conditions with appropriate OR checks.
